The Elder Nun Puṇṇikā’s Verses
“I was a nun in the dispensation🔽of the Fortunate Vipassī,
and of the sages Sikhī, Vessabhū,
Kakusandha, and Koṇāgamana.
And in the dispensation of the Buddha Kassapa,
having gone forth,
I was a nun endowed with virtue,
alert, with faculties restrained.
I was learned, a bearer of the Teaching,🔽one who questions for the sake of the Teaching’s meaning,
and I was one who had grasped the Teaching,
and I was one who had attended on the ear.
I was one who taught in the midst of the people

analyzed: jina sāsane  bāhu saccena tena āha
translated: in the Jina’s dispensation;🔽because of my great learning
I was arrogant, a good nun.
But in my last existence now,
in Sāvatthī, the best of cities,
I was born in the house of Anāthapiṇḍika,
a slave girl who had been bought for a pot.
I went to fetch water,
and I saw a bird in the sky;

analyzed: sītaṭṭam toya majjhamhi  tam disvā idam abravi
translated: I saw it in the middle of the water,🔽on a cool spot, and I said this:
‘I always fetch water,
and I always cross the water;
I am afraid of the punishment of my masters,
and I am afraid of the danger of a verbal offence.
Brahmin, of whom are you afraid?
Always crossing the water;
With my limbs burning,
I feel a lot of cold.’
‘You know me, my lady,
Puṇṇikā, you ask me;
Doing wholesome deeds,
Repenting for bad deeds done.🔽Whether old or young,

original: Yo ce vuḍḍho daharo vā,🔽pāpakammaṁ pakubbati;
analyzed: yaḥ ce vuḍḍhaḥ daharaḥ vā  pāpa kammam pakubbati
translated: If one does bad deeds,
By sprinkling with water, they are freed
From bad deeds.’
I spoke to him as he was leaving,
Words connected with the meaning of the Dhamma;
Having heard that, he was stirred,
And after going forth, he was worthy.
Having filled the hundred less one,
I was born into a family of slaves;
From then on they called me Puṇṇā,
And they made me work.
Then after following the merchant,
I went forth into homelessness;
Not long after that,
I attained Liberation.
I have mastery over psychic power,
And the divine ear element;
I have mastery over the knowledge of the minds of others,
Great Sage.
I know my past lives,
And the divine eye is purified;
All the pollutants are destroyed,
There is no continuation of existence.
In the meaning, the Dhamma, the phrasing,
and in the replies, just so;
My knowledge is pure and clear,
through the power of the Buddha, the best of men.
Through development, great wisdom,
through learning, I am wise;
Through conceit, I was born in a low family,
but my deeds will not be destroyed.
My defilements are burned up,
I live without defilements.
Welcome indeed it was for me,
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.
The four analytical knowledges,

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ puṇṇikā bhikkhunī imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam puṇṇikā bhikkhunī imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”🔽Thus spoke the nun Punnika, and the Elder Nun Mahapajapati said:🔽“Well done! Well done, Punnika!”
The account of the Elder Nun Punnika is finished.
